creator: mmathuria@infostretch.com
text:
When you enter a WSDL , select a web method and click configure, the sampler 
puts the .wsdl as extension on the path. When run, this does not work 
until ".wsdl" is removed from the path.

For example:
1. I entered http://gumby1/kopernik/glue/hierarchy.wsdl as the WSDL
2. Loaded it
3. Chose a web method
4. Hit configure
5. Gave it data and ran it

It failed saying service was not found

in path it had
/kopernik/glue/hierarchy.wsdl

I removed .wsdl from path and ran it again

it worked...

text:
I'm a little puzzled by the bug. the current implementation gets the value from
<wsdl:port .....>
  <http:address location="blah"/>
</wsdl:port>

did your wsdl have "hierarchy.wsdl" for that value?  if that's the case, it 
means the wsdl is wrong. for example, if you look at a sample .NET wsdl 
http://www.holidaywebservice.com/Holidays/GBSCT/Dates/GBSCTHolidayDates.asmx?WSDL 

you'll see at the bottom the location is just .asmx.  also, which webservice 
toolkit are you using to build your webservice?

thanks

peter
